comments.body: Es una idea sumamente interesante, creo que merece mas votos
This would fit perfectly with the wheat block.
Right now sugar cane doesn’t have much purpose, so this would really neat.
As much as I would want this in game, I feel like Coral wouldn't function like that and it would be damaging the plants themselves(being realistic here).
That, or it could be a combination of say...4 horn coral and 4 horn coral fans and you get 4 or 8 horn coral!
This makes perfect sense (picture it as coral growing denser, since the species doesn't actually change) and makes coral blocks a renewable resource!
Amazing idea.I would like if corals plants can grow to corals blocks formations using bone meal.Its a way to make new corals reefs around the minecraft world.

I think this is the best solution as coral is already farmable. I love using dead brain coral to break up stony textures, but it's a real pain to find new coral reefs especially if you live in a cold climate.

To be honest I think it should be a 2x2 instead of a 9x9. Also one coral in a crafting table should make one coral fan. This would make all coral items renewable as you can obtain regular coral by bonemealing underwater.
I love the idea. I have houses near a coral reef and it would be such a bummer to rip up the reef to get some nice building blocks.

Perhaps some horses can carry more than one or two, maybe
three or even four.
Yeah becaus what if you can bring you dog and moving villagers would be so much easier
Well you both better not fight for the saddle and find an agreement, that settles the mood for both parties!

We already have something kind of similar. If you get on a horse while holding the leash of a llama that your friend is riding, you can ride your horse while pulling the llama (and your friend) along. (And you can even take this further and have a whole train of players riding llamas following you thanks to the llama caravan mechanic.) I think this is one of the best uses for llamas in the game. I think allowing multiple players to ride a single horse would take away from the usefulness of llamas (who are already somewhat rarely used).

I would love for books to be a placeable item. I was thinking it could be similar to candles and sea pickles in that you could stack them in the same blockspace. You could even make it a sort of tradeoff with bookshelves, in that the books are easier to place and are slightly cheaper(as they require no wood) but are less space-efficient since they need to be on top of surfaces. Books with specific content, like enchanted books or signed books, could be limited to single stacks if it isn't practical to program it otherwise.

This is an awesome idea. Bookshelf blocks are outdated, not very decorative, and not very useful. Imagine if you could place books on blocks to be used. And if you could stack them for aesthetics and to be used, and you could fill shelves for aesthetics and to store and use. And (incorporating other suggestions https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360029234311-Dying-books ) if you could dye books you could leave some awesome instructions, like sign in using the red book and read the blue, find the green bookshelves. And people could colour code books on tables or shelves for function or aesthetics. (Now I really want to build a proper library, with candles and lanterns and a couch and fireplace and books strewn everywhere!)
ANY item, like a potion, a sword, a bowl of stew, even a helmet.
This would be useful
This would be very handy for many things, window shutters for example!

This would be very very useful.

Sideways trap doors could be used for to replace the fence gates for the farms if allowed to connect to the fencing.

It could also be used for half doors for a house or a barn.

Like some one else side they can also be used as window shutters or cannon ports on a ship. An that is just to name a few uses for it.

Trap doors have an endless use to them. Please allow them to be placed sideways as well .
Saloon doors and functioning window shutters!
like both ideas but don't forget that this website does prefer to keep ideas seprate posts
I like corn and rice
Moved to proper category.

Good, something other than water, milk and potions.  A beverage made of fruit and you can drink, but does it bring any hunger up?  Lemonade is a refreshing beverage in the summer times and people love it.  I hope the Lemonade makes it to Minecraft, because it would be ashamed if the creators do not bring the popular summertime beverage to the game.

AMAZING

 

I love what you have here

i am too, a big fan of lemonade

i want lemonade in minecraft
Since Lemonade is a refreshing drink, maybe it could give you energy and restore your hunger.
Voted!
Maybe water could be part of the recipe since people use water in lemonade in real life.

Redstone is used mainly as a wiring system, I don't see how compressed powder would hold up in physical abuse (like mining or attacking) or how effective it would be. It would also be very hard to implement dynamic lighting that follows the player that wouldn't require a massive use of resources. :(

How about this:

 

When you attack a block with a redstone tool, that block is now powered.
If you use this tool, it would be nice to have electricity around you
Its not my favorite idea but it would be cool if you could have an item so when you hit redstone with it it emits a signal.
Activated redstone tools should mine faster and deal more damage than non powerd redstone tools. To activate the tools just put it in a crafting bench with a redstone block/torch

I'd like to also add Redstone Weapons to this

As much as I'd love it to glow constantly - mojang have dismissed torches in player hands for its impact on lag (although series x/ ps5 is now a thing so consoles are way more powerful now so imo they should reconsider)

I think the best way would be to make it like the redstone ore, when you hit with it (both mining or attacking), it activates light for a few seconds, then switches off

It should be as enchantable as every other tool/weapon rather than being some seperate special self powered thing
Yeah but you need iron to mine redstone.
i think it will make redstone machines much much much easier!
Neat idea. I think that the Withered Bones could also be used as a potion ingredient to make a Potion of Decay.
The new nether update is perfect for this. It has regular bone fossils. could be changed to withered bones.

I was thinking of this too!! But wither bone meal should grow nether warts and maybe weeping and twisted vines

It could also grow some new crop with a cool use that will come in the nether update
I like this idea, especially the Wither Bones stuff, the Stray thing I'm not sure unless they are unique and their bone meal have uses and bone block look colder and frozen design to normal bone

I agree. Withered bones should be able to be crafted into a bonemeal variant which grows nether-vegetation like netherwart. It could be used to kill overworld plants. Also, stray bone-bonemeal could frost an area of grass or stop plants from growing (while not killing them). I like your ideas! These are what I thought of.
There are also other blocks that should be waterloggable.

As this site is for beedback on every version, we should clarify as : finish the waterlogged tag on Minecraft Java Edition, because this is a supported feature on Bedrock.
Why ?
This would at first remove a bit more the gap between the 2 versions. Secondly it would remove forgotten air bubbles in shipwrecks with generated door, and make them more esthetic. It would finally finish to extand build possibilities on Java, mostly on all underwater themed builds (which are common !).

How ? Two options :
1) By making the tag supported by the following blocks, which would get as well their model with water. (Not exhaustive list) :
- bed
- anvil
- rail
- carpet ?
- plants ? (Grass, flower, bamboo, leaves) --> See impact for farms.
- fence gates
- etc.

2) by finishing what Jeb started working on if it hasn't been trashed : making fluids working separately from blocks, allowing easy support for a wide range of blocks including the list below, and would as well allow the same support for lava or snow (it's not a fluid but bedrock support snow in plants for example) This could be extended to bedrock. This may ask a lot of work but it has already been extended greatly, and this could be done aside from the main theme as it is done for tagia.

This should for sure be considered, and would make happy a lot of builders (when Jeb presented water in leaves, trust me around me it made noise.)
If you're a player and agree with this comment, please consider voting, to show your support and your interest!
I 100% agree with this. Doors need to be waterloggable before the 1.14 update.

I think doors should be a waterlogged feature, however, I think when you place them down in source blocks, they remove the source blocks like they do now. The only way to waterlog would be through manual water buckets. Why, because doors are a major strategy on water monuments and super helpful when exploring shipwrecks and other underwater things without respiration, conduits, or a potion.

@marioguitare.gt

You explained the request a whole lot better then I did, It's a shame it is still yet to be implemented!
Could you please include some more detail about what the different shields and totems should be like?

Hello, I think there is so much missed potential in the combat system (defensive gear included) as well as new forms of weaponry: Halberds, Daggers, Various forms of Swords and Defensive Gear: Shields made from various forms of wood and then iron, gold, diamond, shulker, etc. Now as for totems it would be nice if there was a variety that gave you various buffs and debuffs to mix it up a little and not have you wearing a shield at all times. These buffs could include damage boost, speed boost, water breathing, invisibility etc... Each buff would be accompanied by a debuff or downside: IE the invisibility buff could only happen for ten seconds af a time every minute or the damage boost decreases your defense. The totems would be rare boss drops. This could tie into a future cave/dungeon update where dungeon's are more frequent and resemble that of an instance in dungeon crawling games where you fight your way to a main boss.

364480234611 I will do that for him. There could be various totems for various things. There is Totem of Undying, so there could be a Totem of Haste, Totem of Regeneration, Totem of Luck etc. Each Totem would have a different Eye colour, for example, The Totem of Haste could have Diamond-colour eyes.
I like it but maybe make the enchantment not take down like boss and mini boss mobs because there's already Impaling, Sharpness, and Smite enchantments in game. Happy New Year bro!

I think it should provide armor points, but very minimal.

I think an enchantment to increase punch damage is a good idea, but it should be called "brass knuckles"
A gauntlet that makes enchantments upgraded when you have them on. It makes silk touch be able to pick up spawners, makes efficiency be able to mine dragon eggs and makes fire aspect into soul fire.

Here's what I'm thinking:

Gauntlets are included in every armor pack. They provide minimal protection, but increase punching damage to mobs AND blocks (higher level gauntlets are as good as swords/pickaxes). Therefore, they can be enchanted as armor, weapons, or mining tools.
Moved post to item category, clarified header to official name: Golden Apple.

hey, I might have the golem you’re looking for. Feel free to include the link if you wish.

 

link: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360022157471-Monster-Golem
Notch (enchanted golden) apples are supposed to be hard to get.  End of story.
Bilbo  this would be hard to get because it would be in the center of a biome or dimension with a boss defending it
It should be guarded by a dragon based on Ladon.

Brilliant idea!  I linked it in my Lifeboats suggestion because word of this needs to spread.

:)
That's... pretty clever, actually. It wouldn't be too difficult for them to implement either. As long as it still displays the name over top when you are looking at it.

I think the trident is powerful enough as a base weapon.  The issue is that it doesn't have the same kind of enchantment options that the sword does.  Impaling is an awesome new enchantment, but it only works on specific underwater mobs (not even on drowned!).  Impaling is a great enchantment for raiding an ocean monument, but not much else.

I happen to have a suggestion covering adding more of the appropriate enchantments to the trident (and axe): (link)
Tridents are op dude.
tridents are like one of the most powerful weapons out there.
What about the golden gear
i guess they make impaling like sharpness, they add flame and kb enchantments for trident (java)
Making new recipes such as adding diamonds on the trident to make the attacks more powerful.

Perhaps arrows could be tipped with water, which makes the water rain down underneath it as it travels.

That dripping water could be used as a substitute for rain/water blocks, allowing the enchantments that require it to be used in clear weather/underground. Impaling could also act as it does in bedrock, dealing extra damage to any wet mob (which splash potions or even the previously mentioned arrow could inflict enemies with).

This could even be applicable while in the nether, as dangerous and overpowered as that may be!

I think Tridents should be better in a unique way. When throwing it tt's less powerful than a fully enchanted bow and when using left clicking its less powerful than a fully enchanted sword. This makes it practically useless in many combat situations. I think adding either a unique enchantment or ability to add an extra edge would make more of a place for it in combat, making combat more interesting. It has channeling and riptide but those only work in rain, making it inconsistent, so its not worth an inventory slot.

I think that adding more reach when using a trident would add this extra edge. It wouldn't be much, but  it would go with the whole idea of a trident's shape lengthwise, almost as if it were a spear. I would balance this with a longer delay between swings or two types of melee attacks with a trident, a basic one and a lunge, the latter having increased damage and an increased range with the cost of a longer recharge and maybe it moved you forward more. 

Basically add another use to the trident and balance it.

more damage, enchants: allow it to go through armor to an extent, more damage in the rain/in water, faster charge speed, and being able to add potion effects to it for 1-3 hits, maybe by dipping it into potions in cualdrons but u would need to add the mechancic that allows potion in culdrons to java, or u coudl do it in the crafting grid, but idk how that would work with enchants
i never realized i wanted that but yes
Huh.  I never noticed that before.  Good idea.
You should also be able to smelt or craft multiple panes into a single multi colored pane (like stained glass). I end up with left over panes and no use for them, be nice to put them together.
You can automatically make armor stands have arms using command blocks.

My thought would be to add a new recipe using an armor stand and some leather that would make a Mannequin. This would be able to be posed, and maybe even used as a training dummy, taking less of a toll on weapon durability.
I have always wanted bats to have a drop, and I have always thought of the obvious, a bat wing, rotten flesh, even an apple, but fangs are a great drop for bats!

My worry is the connotation this would bring.   Bats aren't evil as they often are depicted in literature and history.  

If there was a bat drop it would have to be Guano.  This is an actual product humans use for fertilization in the real world.  However, the game already has bone meal, so there would be no need for it.

Ok, since the bats in minecraft are entirely passive, my guess is they are fruit or insect eaters.  Even if they were vampire bats, their fangs would be smaller than a cat's and not poisonous.  We already have a drop to make poison potions, and they come from a mob that is actually poisonous.

I like the idea of bats having a drop, but this one makes zero sense.
Just search fang and you'll find the fang and desert thing that is my plan rate it

I would suggest a "rainbow" block that has to be named with the players own name in an anvil. Crafting recipe would be: 1 diamond block, one iron block, one emerald block, one gold block, one redstone block, one coal block, one lapislazuli block, one quarz block. In the center could be something more expensive, like a netherstar. If the player places the named rainbow block, the 16*16 area (1 chunk) that this rainbow block is placed in, is claimed. It can not be placed into chunks that already have been claimed. This block would be the only block that CAN be destroyed by other players, so the owner of the block has to protect it by building other blocks around it. If destroyed (creeper explosion, tnt, other) or harvested, a regular unnamed rainbow block is dropped, and the claim is revoked. If the named rainbow block is dropped, it looses its naming, and instead a regular, unnamed rainbow is dropped. They can not be used inside an area of +-1000 blocks around the spawn (this would discourage new players). This "claim-free" area width could be defined by a command. A player can craft and place/claim as much as 16 named rainbow blocks by standard. There could be a server command to re-define this amount. On re-definition with a value lower than the previous value, all claimed chunks are unclaimed, and all existant placed named diamond blocks become regular diamond blocks. The players will have to re-claim their territory after such a re-definition.

The recipe of such a block would be found in a book in dungeons, as described in following post:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360043516552-Unlock-recipes-one-by-one

The effect of this protection would be a minecraft secret. It could be put into a secret book:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360043568632-Minecraft-secrets-in-dungeon-books

Totally agree. Why is this still not a thing?
Espically for realms servers.

Generally, for pc/java servers we already have several great options such as greifprevention or factions or towny or kingdoms... Ect.

But realms..? It would be great for realms.

Perhaps something. A bit more akin to protection stones plugin. (Defunct plugin)

For instance.. 1 emerald block creates a protection area of 16 blocks.

But.. 8 emerald blocks creates an area of 64 blocks.

But only surface to sky.
If a player wants to protect anything say..past 5 blocks underhim he would have to create another proection block from say... Gold or lapis blocks.
And that would protect all the way to bedrock to sky.

Allow the player to define what he wants.. Like.. Add a friend to crops, or open doors.. Ect.

I want this, because will help a lot of users in multiplayer.

It's like the reclaim block from "7 days to die". Has a % of degradation if the user not access To the server in few days, the block will get useless.

I suggest adding a feature to the land claim block. Each Minecraft player could only put down one claim block and the land claim block would not only show the chunk border but also keep the chunk active no matter where a player is in the game. This land claim block could be moved only by the player who placed it but could also be used to identify chunks for chunk aligning Redstone contraptions and farms
Agreed but tell us what you think that utility should be!
Gold tools have the fastest speed faster than diamond but have bad durbiltuy
I once converted 26 gold blocks into pickaxes in survival.  Don’t ask why.
Anvils have the limit of 39 levels. This limit could be removed in case of golden tools and armour.
Gold tools have a much higher chance of receiving rarer and higher-level enchantments already. I'll admit it would be nice to see some other use though.

I agree gold armour should be more useful. How about the same reason gold was worn in real life: To look good and show the wearer was rich. Like leather can be dyed, I think gold armour should be dyable as well.
Golden tools have increased chance to get good enchantment , if only smithing table works with golden tools too !!
Gold Armor can pacify piglins.
Yes, this makes a lot of sense. I'd always wondered who would ever spend diamonds on something as transient as a firework :P

Keep it an enemy forever. Its a love hate relationship, you can manipulate it, but never tame it. It'd also require some heavy new changes to current mobs interacting with this mob.

It'd completely undervalue the Iron Golem, the Creaking is immortal, would eventually kill its target or be in a forever blink contest with ranged mobs, and be so inefficient if it also couldn't move while other mobs were looking at it, assuming you want the mob to be consistent in its sight gimmick. Since its considered a hostile mob initially, it'd probably always go 1v1, exception being grouped attackers.

If hostile mobs could attack the Creaking by breaking the Creaking Heart it'd make it very weak or have some weird explanation why suddenly mobs can break blocks which wouldn't be consistent within Minecraft. 

It's just not suited to be tamable/befriended. I keep seeing this idea, but it hasn't been thought out through enough, it's way too finicky, either a overpowered immortal golem or a underpowered statue sprinkler for a small crop field. I'm pretty sure you can pull off some unique sight-based redstone with this mob too, not just for defense purposes.

Dyeing/painting wood has always been a rejected idea that they won't implement, instead being why we have a variety of different trees/wood types to otherwise use (or get creative with other types of colours in other blocks).

This is what I've been thinking! And maybe it won't happen since they've said in the past that wood won't be dyeable, but maybe since it's pale, the colours could all stay pale, and bring in a full spectrum of pastel colours? (As much as I'd like a deep blue wood, I'm sure that can come from some more fantastical tree eventually!) (Also I had the thought that maybe painted logs no longer activate the Creaking Heart, or maybe give the Creaking different coloured eyes or something?)
Also the possibility of torches being able to be held in the offhand in bedrock? That technically would be java parity but still.
Minecraft needs more physics
I think it should be lanterns, not torches.

It doesn't exist because dynamic lighting is a performance issue for the base game, by having blocks constantly update their light levels at the speed of the player, and this would especially make MC inaccessible for low-end PC players.
No optifine
It's so annoying having to mine in pitch darkness when you run out of torches. I will be able to atleast save one torch so I'm not playing blind.
A good idea. But first, it’s worth adding opponents with shields to the game.
By the way, it's worth renaming "Thorns", because in reality the spikes will not harm the enemy with weapons, especially ranged ones, it's more like "Reflection" or "Return", but not "Thorns".
